intro: Vernonia jelskii var. virescens, commonly known as the greenleaf ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves that are typically a vibrant green. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green to brownish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fibrous root system makes it drought-tolerant and adaptable to various soil types. It is often found in open woods, prairies, and along roadsides, contributing to its ecological significance in native habitats.
